TOPIC.HEAD: EIFFEL_DOCUMENT
TOPIC.TEXT: You should use this tag as the first tag of you document.

TOPIC.HEAD: TOPIC
TOPIC.TEXT: The topic tag lets you create a new help-topic. With a topic, you must specify either an ID or a LOCATION. If you specify an ID, this becomes the identifier of the topic. You must now provide in this topic a HEAD and either subtopics or text. If you choose to specify a location, you must enter the filename of the topic you want to insert in the tree. The topic will substituted by the root-topic of that file.

TOPIC.HEAD: HEAD
TOPIC.TEXT: Specify the head of a help-topic. You cannot use mark-up tags within a HEAD tag, because it also will be displayed in the Tree-view.

TOPIC.HEAD: TEXT
TOPIC.TEXT: If a topic contains text, you can put the paragraphs in TEXT-tags. Within text-topics, you can use these tags: FONT, BR, IMP, A, B, I, U. Underlined text is not yet supported by the topic display area (EV_RICH_TEXT)

TOPIC.HEAD: FONT
TOPIC.TEXT: With FONT you can specify NAME, SIZE and COLOR. Example: <FONT NAME="Arial" SIZE="16" COLOR="blue"> The NAME is not (yet) platform independent. The NAME and SIZE are not implemented yet on Unix.

TOPIC.HEAD: IMP
TOPIC.TEXT: All words that you put in a IMP-tag will show up in the search-index and you will be able to find the topic in the search-results list of that keyword. The search is case-insensitive.

TOPIC.HEAD: A
TOPIC.TEXT: You can use anchors in your body text. to make a link to another topic within the ENTIRE system, use <A TOPIC_ID="General"> Be sure to type the name correct. Case sensitive. Not yet supported, but feel free to start using it: HREF
